title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 24 October 2012 - XWiki
content:

13:05 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
13:05 <cdop> guys, appwithinaminute is just awesome. incredible. big like!  
13:05 <vmassol> cdop: great, y'oure ripe for leaving a quote on  http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/References/Testimonials :)  
13:06 <vmassol> lunch, bbl  
13:06 <sburjan> tmortagne1: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise43M1 ?  
13:17 <vmassol> has quit  
13:19 <sburjan> why did you deleted the page ?  
13:31 <Denis> has quit  
13:32 <sburjan> I get a nice stacktrace when starting the 4.3 M1 manager :)  
13:37 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
13:39 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
13:42 <vmassol> sburjan: this page is not the right one  
13:42 <vmassol> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki43M1  
13:42 <sburjan> ok. Then fmancinelli linked the wrong page in the e-mail  
13:44 <sburjan> in the meantime: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8365  
13:45 <tmortagne1> sburjan:  http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise43M1 is not the right page  
13:45 <tmortagne1> vmassol already told you actually  
13:45 <sburjan> yes. I replied to vmassol  
13:45 <vmassol> and I replied to the list  
13:45 <vmassol> :)  
13:46 <sburjan> and I saw :)  
13:46 <cjd> vmassol: hello, I understand there is a requirement that all contrib projects list org.xwiki.contrib as the parent, this is why I've not asked yet to include xwiki-platform-realtime-editor in contrib since it inherits from platform..  
13:47 <tmortagne1> sburjan: could you check if you have duplicated jars on different versions  
13:48 <tmortagne1> XE does not have the issue so maybe wikimanage or appmanager have a dependency in a version different than the one in XE for some reason  
13:48 <vmassol> cjd: that shouldn't be a problem  
13:48 <vmassol> cjd: you need to define what you need  
13:48 <cjd> If it's important to use contrib and change the directory structure, I'll open an issue for it  
13:49 <tmortagne1> cjd: org.xwiki.contrib does not have to be the parent actually, it has to be the groupid prefix  
13:49 <vmassol> cjd: I've tried to explain the reason to use contrib over your own repo, dunno if I've convinced you  
13:49 <vmassol> for me it's important  
13:49 <vmassol> but we can't force any contributor  
13:49 <vmassol> it's their choices  
13:49 <tmortagne1> sop that your extension is deployed somehwre in http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/org/xwiki/contrib/  
13:50 <tmortagne1> you can use whatever you want as parent  
13:50 <tmortagne1> s/sop/so/  
13:50 <cjd> well the parent thing is good since changing the parent is the most painful with all of the versions  
13:51 <vmassol> cjd: I'd be curious to know why you need platform as parent though since there's very little in the platform parent pom  
13:52 <vmassol> (and it's not supposed to be reusable by outside project btw  
13:52 <vmassol> )  
13:52 <tmortagne1> s/whatever/whatever parent/  
13:53 <cjd> I wrote it so that it would be possible to include in xwiki-platform-core without any modification  
13:53 <vmassol> yes that's a valid point  
13:53 <vmassol> anyway as thomas said you can use whatever parent you wish  
13:53 <vmassol> and even for the group id, you could use the platform one provided  
13:53 <tmortagne1> IMO what's important is the groupId, all the rest should be free  
13:53 <vmassol> you send a vote and there's an agreement to merge this contrib project in platform  
13:53 <cjd> how about the artifact id? is xwiki-platform-realtime ok?  
13:54 <tmortagne1> yep it's ok IMO  
13:54 <vmassol> ah on this we have started some differet modules with Enygma` for autocompletion  
13:54 <vmassol> let me find it  
13:54 <vmassol> related to editors  
13:54 <tmortagne1> yea then there could be collision with other contrib sure  
13:55 <cjd> I'm pretty sure everything is different now, I modified the pom.xml files pretty thoroughly  
13:56 <cjd> the groupid is not very hard, what is hard is reorganizing the directory structure twice, that's what held me back from pushing to contrib earlier.. seeing that you guys have no objections to the platform centric dir structure it doesn't seem like a major issue at all  
13:57 <vmassol> cjd: re the artifactid it doesn't matter, we can change it later on if/when we decide to integrate in platform  
13:58 <vmassol> Enygma`: that reminds me that we haven't integrated autocomplete in platform… nor published it on e.x.o… oops :(  
13:58 <vmassol> (I had started but stopped)  
13:58 <vmassol> (I have uncommitted changes locally about that)  
14:01 <cjd> off topic: go is an incredibly interesting language, it's like C for the 21st century and there's nothing in the spec preventing implementations from becoming insanely fast  
14:02 <Enygma`> vmassol: I know  
14:24 <fmancinelli> sburjan, I just downloaded xwiki-manager-jetty-mysql-4.3-milestone-1.zip and started it and it works fine (I mean it starts up and I can log to the home without any exception)  
14:24 <sburjan> nothing in the console ?  
14:25 <sburjan> fmancinelli: note I am using with MySQL  
14:25 <fmancinelli> yep me too  
14:26 <sburjan> ok. trying again  
14:26 <sburjan> maybe someone else could try. a 3rd party :)  
14:26 <fmancinelli> I just had a pre-existing database... it did the migration and then I was presented with the home page (Main Wiki.... What is a Workspace, etc.)  
14:27 <tmortagne1> has quit  
14:28 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
14:29 <sburjan> fmancinelli: I am still able to reproduce.  
14:29 <sburjan> (using a clean install)  
14:31 <sburjan> it's a tie :) we need a referee :)  
14:31 <fmancinelli> lol  
14:31 <fmancinelli> Vincent was suggesting to check if you have some environment variables overriding the classpath or things like that  
14:31 <fmancinelli> which JRE are you using?  
14:32 <sburjan> my god  
14:32 <fmancinelli> are you using start\_xwiki.sh?  
14:32 <sburjan> yes. It seems that when I updated, I got Java 7  
14:32 <fmancinelli> I have it too :)  
14:33 <sburjan> java version "1.7.0\_07"  
14:33 <sburjan> OpenJDK Runtime Environment (IcedTea7 2.3.2) (7u7-2.3.2a-1ubuntu1)  
14:33 <sburjan> OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (build 23.2-b09, mixed mode)  
14:33 <sburjan> you're using the bigO ?  
14:33 <fmancinelli> yep  
14:33 <sburjan> ok, so maybe openjdk 7 is not ok with xwiki :)  
14:33 <sburjan> going back to 1.6  
14:34 <fmancinelli> java version "1.7.0\_03"  
14:34 <fmancinelli> Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 22.1-b02, mixed mode)  
14:34 <vmassol> fabio: 2 points  
14:35 <fmancinelli> ok so OpenJDK it's a good candidate to be the cause of the issue  
14:35 <sburjan> fmancinelli: yes. switching back to openJDK 6  
14:36 <cjd> Do I have to ask for permission on the list before pushing this to contrib?  
14:37 <cjd> I seem to recall the sandbox was wide open but contrib mainspace was on a per-request basis  
14:37 <cjd> but that was a while ago  
14:37 <vmassol> cjd: see http://contrib.xwiki.org  
14:38 <vmassol> http://markmail.org/thread/2qtiw6ynqv4jgwym ;)  
14:39 <vmassol> if you have the creds to create the repo the idea is just to let others know that we new project is being created  
14:39 <sburjan> fmancinelli: rebooting, I still got the error, but now I have java 6 in java -version. trying with a reboot  
14:40 <sburjan> has quit  
14:40 <cjd> ok  
14:40 <cjd> you can see why it's attractive to just use one's own space  
14:40 <vmassol> wdym?  
14:41 <cjd> a 30 second push vs. an hour of "paperwork"  
14:41 <vmassol> 1hour?  
14:41 <vmassol> I don't understand  
14:41 <vmassol> we're talking about 1mn here no more  
14:41 <vmassol> the goal of this IS to collaborate  
14:41 <cjd> in another 10 minutes it will be  
14:41 <vmassol> then stop asking question  
14:41 <vmassol> and do it  
14:41 <vmassol> :)  
14:41 <cjd> I'm not saying it's better or worse, just pointing it out  
14:41 <vmassol> well in any case  
14:42 <vmassol> if you want me to say that collaboration is harder than no collaboration then I agree  
14:42 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
14:44 <sburjan> fmancinelli: I still get it even using java 1.6  
14:51 <sburjan> can someone confirm or infirm ?  
14:52 <jvdrean1> has joined #xwiki  
14:55 <jvdrean> has quit  
14:56 <fmancinelli> have you ever used OpenJDK?  
14:56 <fmancinelli> can you test it with Oracle's ?  
14:56 <sburjan> I have always used OpenJDK  
14:56 <sburjan> and it was working well :)  
15:02 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
15:21 <fmancinelli> sburjan, this is weird. I just installed OpenJDK7 and it works fine. java version "1.7.0\_09"  
15:21 <sburjan> fmancinelli: testing on another machine  
15:26 <sburjan> fmancinelli: yes, it seems it's something on my machine.  
15:26 <fmancinelli> (phew)  
15:27 <fmancinelli> So I will close your issue  
15:28 <fmancinelli> actually it would be interesting to see what is different on the machine where it fails  
15:28 <fmancinelli> can you do a diff of your OpenJDK directories on the two machines?  
15:28 <sburjan> removeing java 7 from my computer. seems they can't work in parallel properly  
15:29 <sburjan> I have  
15:29 <sburjan>   0            /usr/lib/jvm/java-7-openjdk-amd64/jre/bin/java   1071      auto mode  
15:29 <sburjan>   2            /usr/lib/jvm/java-7-openjdk-amd64/jre/bin/java   1071      manual mode  
15:29 <sburjan> so it'e either the priority or the auto thing  
15:30 <sburjan> but nothing on the internet says anything about them  
15:30 <sburjan> rebooting  
15:30 <sburjan> has quit  
15:33 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
15:34 <sburjan> my god, i still have it  
15:36 <Denis> has quit  
15:39 <fmancinelli> on the new machine?  
15:40 <sburjan> on my machine after I removed java 7  
15:44 <sburjan> xem 4.2 starts. It only hangs in 4.3 M1 :(  
15:45 <fmancinelli> the easiest way to do is to do a diff of your jdk directories (between the machine where it works and the other) and also of your environment  
15:45 <fmancinelli> sburjan, Marius commented on your issue, so maybe it's something related to what he did... but anyway, it would be interesting to understand why on some JDK installations it works and on othes it doesn't (so a diff would help :))  
15:59 <mflorea> has quit  
16:07 <vmassol> sburjan: it's normal that 4.2 has no problem  
16:08 <vmassol> the usage of xpath has been added in 4.3M1  
16:08 <vmassol> (cf marius's comment)  
16:09 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
16:10 <sburjan> vmassol: odd thing is that it works for fmancinelli  
16:11 <fmancinelli> sburjan, it works for you as well Sorin (on the other machine) ;)  
16:11 <sburjan> exactly  
16:14 <mflorea> fmancinelli: I'm going to debug a bit latter on the XEM instance that has the problem to see from what jar is the XPath impl loaded.  
16:35 <Enygma`> cjd (or anyone else knowing): can we use code that requires PR together with ConfigurableClass? Right now I notice that the page with configurable class has PR and the core runs well there, but when I access it from Administration>Applications, PR does not work and the code fails.  
16:36 <cjd> ConfigurableClass makes a dropPermissions() call which precludes using PR in it without {{include}}  
16:37 <Enygma`> and now the question: why? :)  
16:38 <tmortagne> Enygma`: security, you have several example or how to use include macro to have an admin page that require PR  
16:38 <Enygma`> because ConfigurableClass pages are included without context=new and the PR is checked for XWikiPreferences instead of the other page?  
16:38 <cjd> correct  
16:38 <tmortagne> there is no include for an object  
16:39 <tmortagne> and the admin page content is in an object from admin point of view  
16:39 <tmortagne> so it's a bit of a pain to do a safe include of the Configurable content in admin UI using velocity  
16:41 <Enygma`> but why don`t we use context=new by default for Applications? (ConfigurableClass)  
16:41 <Enygma`> Applications usually care about their domain, not about XWikiPreferences  
16:42 <tmortagne> Enygma`: what does that mean using context=new ?  
16:42 <Enygma`> (to me) making sure that PR is checked for the page the include comes from and not the page that it is rendered on (XWikiPreferences)  
16:43 <tmortagne> as i just said it's a pain to do in velocity that's all, when we  will add object support to display macro then we can use it  
16:44 <Enygma`> tmortagne: you mentioned some examples, can you please name one so I can look it up?  
16:44 <tmortagne> there used to be EM but I don't think it's a ConflurableClass anymore, I think you have search admin with this need  
16:46 <Enygma`> actually searchAdmin is what I am working with :)  
16:46 <tmortagne> not search actually  
16:47 <tmortagne> let me see I don't remember  
16:48 <tmortagne> anyway the idea is to use include another page with context=new  
16:49 <Enygma`> ok then, I see  
16:49 <Enygma`> thank you  
17:02 <vmassol> cjd: I can create a component for you  
17:02 <vmassol> (jira component)  
17:03 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XCONTRIB#selectedTab=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.project%3Acomponents-panel  
17:03 <vmassol> done  
17:03 <vmassol> "Realtime Editor"  
17:05 <cjd> ok  
17:05 <vmassol> when you need to do a release you'll have to create a version too  
17:09 <cjd> I think I have the pom set up correctly so releasing should make it ExtensionManager compatable  
17:13 <vmassol> cool  
17:31 <Slashman> has quit  
17:33 <cdop> hmm, an entry of an appwithinamin doesnt inherint the access-rights of the app... so although the app is restricted, even a non-registered user can see its entries.  
17:34 <cdop> i guess i missed something.  
17:36 <mflorea> has quit  
17:57 <coud> has joined #xwiki  
17:59 <vmassol> has quit  
18:04 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
18:04 <cdop> ok, how to let this expression be false? "$xwiki.hasAccessLevel('register', 'XWiki.XWikiPreferences')"  
18:05 <cdop> i want to disable/hide the register-link in the menuview.vm  
18:06 <cdop> (registering is done via ldap)  
18:06 <evalica> has quit  
18:16 <tmortagne> cdop: go in the administration  
18:17 <tmortagne> in the right administration you can remove the register right given to guest user by default  
18:18 <Enygma`> has quit  
18:18 <tmortagne> don't forget to select "Users" in the table  
18:19 <cdop> found it thanks!  
18:19 <tmortagne> You're Welcome :)  
18:22 <cdop> :)
